question: What does my ticket play for?
answer: Your ticket plays for prizes every day of the week. Every day, players in 20 postcodes each win £1,000 per ticket. Every Saturday, players in one postcode win a share of £1 Million in our Millionaire Street prize. Every month, players could also win £250,000 for every ticket in one winning postcode, or one lucky postcode sector wins a share of our Postcode Millions prize. On rare occasions, if there are not enough winning tickets in a postcode sector, the area may be expanded to the postcode district. See our How It Works page for more details.

question: How can I tell if I'm a winner?
answer: You can check if you’ve won by viewing the Lottery Results section on our website or calling our freephone number 0808 109 8765. Winners are also notified by email, SMS, letter, or phone depending on the prize won. Ensure your contact details are up to date so we can notify you of any prize wins.

question: When will I receive my prize money?
answer: If you pay by Direct Debit or have already registered your bank account details, prize money is usually transferred within 28 days. If you haven’t registered your bank details, please call 0808 109 8765 so we can arrange your payment.

question: What non-cash prizes can I win?
answer: Non-cash prizes include Prize Vouchers for the Lotteryshop (over 30 prize options), e-Gift Cards from pre-selected retailers, and Letterbox Prizes redeemable against a range of items. Prizes are subject to stock availability.

question: How is the weekly Millionaire Street £1 Million prize shared?
answer: Each Saturday, the £1 Million prize is shared between tickets in the winning postcode. The maximum prize per ticket is 10% of ticket sales for that draw, up to £500,000. If this limit prevents the £1 Million from being fully distributed, the balance will be shared among tickets in the surrounding postcode sector or district.

question: What’s the difference between a postcode and a postcode sector?
answer: A postcode sector is a larger geographic area than a postcode. For example, EH2 4ET is a postcode; its postcode sector is EH2 4, and the postcode district is EH2.

question: When are the winning postcodes for prize vouchers announced?
answer: Winning postcodes for prize vouchers are announced according to the Prize Draw Calendar. Check the calendar to see if a prize voucher is available in the next draw.

question: How are players notified that they have won a prize voucher?
answer: Players with an email address on their account will receive an email including a voucher code to redeem their prize when the winning postcodes are announced. Players without an email address will receive a letter later that week.

question: How long do I have to redeem my e-Gift Card?
answer: You have two months from the date your prize is announced to claim your e-Gift Card. Once claimed, the validity depends on the retailer's Gift Card Terms and Conditions.

question: How long do I have to redeem my prize voucher?
answer: The expiry date for your voucher is included in your winner notification. If you do not redeem your voucher by this date, it will expire and cannot be reissued.

question: What if I have more than one ticket and win a prize voucher?
answer: All winners receive one voucher per ticket played. For example, if you play two tickets, you can redeem two prizes. When logging into voucher.postcodelottery.co.uk, it will indicate how many prizes you have left to redeem.

question: Why have I won an e-Gift Card?
answer: During monthly draws, we may include e-Gift Cards from pre-selected national retailers as prizes. This is just one of many prizes available with your subscription. e-Gift Cards are separate from Refer A Friend or player thank you rewards.

question: When do Postcode Millions happen?
answer: Postcode Millions prizes occur during major draws each year. Players are automatically entered into every draw, including Postcode Millions draws, with no need to buy separate tickets.

question: Do I need to buy separate tickets for Postcode Millions draws?
answer: No. Each ticket you play is automatically entered into all draws, including Postcode Millions.
